intro: Lasianthus japonicus subsp. longicaudus, commonly known as the Japanese long-tailed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated calyx that resembles a tail. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, often blooming in late summer. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
